column2: Carol, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Started using Angeliq 3 years ago.  My hot flashes disappeared, my skin, hair and nails started growing.  I had more energy and my mood improved immensly.  I stopped using it for 4months and everything went down hill.  My hair fell out in chunks and I was so depressed.  Started taking it again and I feel fantastic.

column2: Chemist, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: This drug works great to reduce hot flashes, night sweats and moodiness.  I have been taking it for 21/2 years but do have bleeding every couple of weeks.  I can also sleep! It is important to take it about the same time everyday.

column2: tljrow, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Hot flashes went away immediately, but started vaginal bleeding and headaches more than usual. Experienced loss of desire for most everything. Have cut my dose in half by taking every other day and will start a bioidentical menopause cream I found through Daystar.

column2: DPD, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I took Angeliq for 3 years and had frequent, excruciating headaches that lasted for up to 3 days and could not be quelled even by Vicodin or muscle relaxers. My doctor thought they were related to a bulging disc in my neck. She and I never associated my headaches with this drug, which did work on the menopausal symptoms for which I was taking it. Four months ago I switched to Combipatch, and I have not had ONE headache since the switch. Now I'm certain my headaches were related to Angeliq.
This hormone caused a weight redistribution similar to cortisone.  It should not even be on the market.

column2: venice54, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: relieved bloating and vaginal dryness. improved libido and cellulite disapeared !! yearly control all fine . hair and nails improved greatly.

column2: krobinson307, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
singer, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: It eased my hot flashes within days, then I started bleeding again!  I have gone to another pill.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Since 49 have had hot flashes occasionally, big mood swings, loss of desire completely, no regular sleep pattern. Now 53. After 6 months on this no more hot flashes, that's about it. Still not sleeping, no desire, gained 10 pounds and still gaining, mood has changed but not neccesarily better. Cannot find a hormone or combination that works for all. After 4 years I feel like I have tried everything.

column2: schexj77@aol, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: right now ive noticed my breast are senisitive and itch like a rash

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Angeliq eliminated mood swings, hot flashes, insomnia and reduced bloating.  Started having periods, one lasted a few weeks.  Tried this after having no luck with over the counter options.  Started perimenopause at 47, resorted to HRT at 50, no regrets.  I feel like myself again.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Could not stand the hot flashes and lack of sleep anymore & have been taking this for 3 months now. Body temp has gone back to normal again - yeah! No more flashes, sleeping like a baby! Additional benefits of reduced dryness & increased libido. Only negative I have is edema. My ankles & calves are swelling and I now have to wear support hose every day. Otherwise I am very happy with this medication.

column2: Disappointed, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Been taking this for about 5 months. Started bleeding after being period free for 3 years.  Dull headaches almost daily.  No decrease in vaginal dryness or increase in libido. Hot flashes were never a problem. So, basically, the drug has been ineffective.  At $50 copay/mthly dosage it is not worth it.

column2: LISA, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I AM HAVE ONLY BEEN TAKING ANGELIQ FOR JUST OVER A WEEK, I HAVE HAD MUSCLE CRAMPS, ESP IN MY LOWER RIGHT LEG, NOT SURE IF I NEED TO CHANGE TO DIFFERENT MED, HOT FLUSHES WERE KEEPING ME AWAKE, NOW THE LEG CRAMPS ARE TOO.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I took Angeliq for 3 weeks I had horrible headaches that narcotics couldn't relieve, itching, a lot of my hair was falling out, and I could barely wear my contacts. After the second week I came down with an upper respiratory infection/sinusitis, which I haven't in over two years.  I quit it.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I ve been taking this drug for just over 6 months, initially put on a bit of weight but after 2 months it settled down. The only downside is that my fybroids which were shrinking have started to grow again. Hopefully this will slow down again.

column2: rondarae, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: have been taking for 6 mths and then the night sweats and hot flashes returned - muscle cramps and depression - i took myself off this hormone and have an appt to see Dr for something else

column2: susan, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Nothing happened for the first five days, then all at once it worked.   No more hot flashes at night, then a few days later the hot flashes during the day just stopped.   It was wonderful!    No other side effects yet just feeling normal again!

column2: jan, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Angeliq is great! I had begun having lots of hot flashes, lack of concentration, depression...I feel good and like I have my life back...I know there are risks but there is with any med.

column2: FEELING BETTER, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been on this HRT for 4 months and it has been great!! No hot flashes, night sweats, insomnia, mood swings, and vaginal dryness, all went away after a few weeks. I work out at least 5-6 days a week and have noticed that loosing weight has gotten to be really difficult, especially in the stomach area. I took my pill "LATE" "ONE" day as opposed to taking it early in the morning and boy did I have problems. Night sweats two nights in a row, I didn't sleep well for two nights and the bleeding was horriable. So I learned that you need to take it at the exact same time everyday to get the results you are looking for.

column2: Barbara, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: After taking Angeliq for 6 months everything stopped except for the bleeding, some times it would last for 2 weeks. So changed to Estradiol and although this stopped the hot flashes and "spotting" it gave me really bad headache's. So now have just changed to Premphase - lets see it this works!!

column2: nivlag, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Gaining weight all of a sudden fast!  Did help somewhat with hot flashes (still have them occasionally).  Hasn't helped crankiness. Never had night sweats anyway.  This did help with some joint pain I was having.

column2: lilangel1976, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
beachbum222, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was experiencing 8-10 hot flashes per day. I found that after 2 months, my hot flashes completely disappeared.  However, I've experienced increased appetite and have put on weight in a relatively short period of time.  Now, I'm not sure which I dislike more - hot flashes or weight gain.

column2: Feelin Good Mom, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This medication has stopped hot flashes after 1 week. Eased the dryness. I was waking up every night at least once. Now I sleep thru the whole night. I have even lost a few pounds without trying. I feel great!

column2: SADIE, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: DID NOT HAVE A PERIOD FOR SIX YEARS. AFTER THREE WEEKS ON ANGELIQ I STARTED BLEEDING. I WOULD RATHER HAVE HOT FLASHES OVER BLEEDING. MY BREASTS HURT AND MY FACE IS BREAKING OUT.

column2: Kathy, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Took Angeliq for 3 months - didn't like it.  Doctor is switching me to Femhrt to try for 2 months.  Experienced daily dull headaches, bloating, joint pain, and the worst symptom - depression.  Things bothered me that normally would never have been any issue.  Felt basically miserable.  Hopefuly the Femhrt will be better, because I am really sick of feeling like this.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: My hot flashes went away completely and I feel normal once again.

column2: sycamore, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been taking this medicine for about 6 weeks.  After one week my hot flashes were gone and my husband said I'm much easier to get along with.  I have more energy, don't seem as hungry all the time and have lost a few pounds.  Yippee!!

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years
column9: After suffering for almost two years, my Gyne started me on this medication. no more hot flashes, night sweats, ache joints,mood swings, I've felt like myself again. I've been taking this drug for a year now and just started signs of my period again, after a year without it. I dread the thought of not taking this medication, but it is short term.

column2: debbied, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: At 50 - menopause was in full swing.  Hot flashes were BRUTAL both day and especially at night.  Waking every hour sweating then freezing from being clammy.  Feet swell, irritability, mood swings - horrible life.  Was adamant that I didn't want to take hormones.  Met with my doctor who spent quite a long time discussing the good, bad and ugly of hormones.  Explained that I probably wouldn't have to take them forever.  Finally, she told me that she had already had her tubes tied and if she had to take a hormone replacement this is the one she would take.  Said I could have periods but this should not cause regular monthly cycles.  Have been taking for almost 2 weeks and the change is remarkable.   Still have some hot flashes but not as severe. Don't plan on taking forever, hope to ween off eventually.  If anyone is suffering like I was, PLEASE, PLEASE see your doctor and discuss this treatment.

column2: DebbieS, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I felt SO MUCH BETTER once I started taking this drug, the night sweats, hot flashes, mood swings went a way.  I had energy again, and concentrate on things again.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: hot flashes and irratability immediately went away. Only negative was started periods again after one year without,but well worth the tradeoff.

column2: doris, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months
column9: i had to stop taking this medication, my joints were hurting.
